learning_outcomes.description: Read and critically analyse current scientific literature pertinent to the area of the occupational hygiene research project.
Formulate research questions and investigate and plan appropriate methods to address these questions, including an appropriate hygiene sampling strategy.
Implement the planned methods, including data collection and analysis, under the guidance of an experienced supervisor.
Record the planning and outcome of data collection accurately and appropriately.
Write a research report in a format appropriate for an occupational hygiene investigation.
Critically discuss the collected data in the context of the literature, draw conclusions from such discussions and suggest further research options.
Appraise their own performance by reflective practice.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to submit a 4000-word project proposal (including a literature review) covering the following elements:

• Title

• General Aim

• Specific objectives/research questions

• Rationale - background and justification of the project

• Literature Review

• Methods

• Resources needed

• References

• Risk Assessment

• Ethical considerations

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to provide an in-person presentation about their project and its findings, and be questioned about the project.

Details on scheduling will be announced during the semester. Please refer to the Blackboard announcement for the assessment scheduled time and location.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to present a research report of 8000 - 10,000 words. The report should be prepared following the AIOH Report Writing Guidelines and other general research report writing guidance. The report should follow the below structure: 

  • Title Page
  • Abstract/Executive Summary
  • Table of Contents
  • List of Tables and/or Figures
  • List of Terms and Abbreviations
  • Introduction
  • Relevant Legislation
  • Process Description
  • Literature Review
  • Method (Research design, subjects, data collection tools, procedures followed, and data analysis)
  • Results
  • Discussion
  • Conclusions and Recommendations
  • Implications for further research
  • References
  • Appendices 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Orientation

This is an orientation session, which will cover the course requirements and starting your research planning.
learning_activities.topic_description: Orientation This is an orientation session, which will cover the course requirements and starting your research planning.

learning_activities.topic:
Research Plan

This session will discuss the research plan, including writing research questions, and thinking about the research methods.
learning_activities.topic_description: Research Plan This session will discuss the research plan, including writing research questions, and thinking about the research methods.

learning_activities.topic:
Research Proposal

This session will discuss the research proposal, including the literature review, methods, timelines and budgets.
